description:
A low-maintenance, high-reward blend

Fescue Rescue is the ideal grass seed for lawns that experience high foot traffic, heat, and drought. Crafted from three premium tall fescue cultivars, it’s designed for dark green color and deep-rooted growth in areas of lawn that can struggle. With improved insect and disease resistance, and tolerance to drought—Fescue Rescue grows quality turf and a green lawn throughout seasonal stress.

sections.why_fescue_rescue_is_our_pick_for_cool_s:
Dark green color
Superior drought tolerance and recovery
Higher resistance to disease and surface-feeding insects
Withstands wear and tear — great for kids and pets!
A-LIST-approved for quality, sustainability, and reduced maintenance
Grows well in full sun to partial shade and in a wide range of soils
Suitable for any cool-season lawn and grass type
High 85% germination rate
sections.whats_included:
3 types of premium turf-type tall fescue grass varieties
One bag covers up to 2,500 sq. ft. of lawn
Sunday seeding rate
For maintenance seeding or overseeding: 2 lbs./1000 sq. ft.
For heavy repair, weedy lawns and new lawns: 8 lbs./1000 sq. ft.
At Sunday, we're serious about grass seed. Hand-selected by turf experts and informed by advanced agronomic technology, each variety we offer is designed to nurture a dark green, sustainable lawn resilient to drought, heat, and disease. With the stamp of A-LIST approval, our seeds are guaranteed to meet high standards of quality, sustainability, and lower maintenance needs. With Sunday, from grower to your lawn, you're getting superior seed quality.
sections.faq:
Helpful Tips from Lawn Advisors:
What is tall fescue?
Tall fescue is a hardy grass seed variety that forms a dense, green lawn. It’s able to resist drought, tolerate shade, and stand up to high traffic, making it perfect for active outdoor spaces.
When to plant fescue grass seed?
The optimal time to seed this mix is during spring and fall when temperatures consistently range between 55 to 75 degrees Fahrenheit. You can also seed this mix in winter months when temperatures hold consistently below 40 degrees F.
How long does fescue grass seed take to grow?
Expect germination between 6-12 days.
How to plant fescue grass seed?
Apply at the correct rate. For overseeding, use 5 lbs. per 2,500 sq. ft., for starting a new lawn from scratch use 8 lbs. per 1,000 sq. ft. For patching, cover the area lightly with seed and topdress with compost or a light layer of soil if desired.
Start at the lowest setting and apply uniformly. For hand or drop spreader applications, no matter the spreader type, always begin at the lowest setting. Increase the spreader setting if the seed is getting stuck or not easily distributed. Walk at a consistent pace across the lawn to uniformly distribute seed. Check after application for uniformity and reapply in areas where coverage is light.
Water the seed to germination. Keep seed moist, not oversaturated, until grass seed germinates - depending on grass type this can be 1-3 weeks. Avoid letting new or germinating seeds dry out to ensure successful seeding.
Sunday Grass Seed Instructions
Step-by-step instructions on how to seed Sunday's premium cool-season grass seed for a thicker, climate-resilient, and weed-free lawn.
